<JD_START>
Job Title: Lead Inspector

Location: Nashville, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Position Summary

Ensures safe work practices are followed. Plan, direct, and coordinate the activities of his/her area so as to minimize delays, and increase production and efficiency. Provides training and to assist subordinates in the proper procedures, methods and practices to be followed in each respective duty.

Job Responsibilities

Assists Technical Support Assistant Manager in making work assignments within area of responsibility.Makes available to personnel the necessary overhaul manuals, service bulletins, airworthiness directives and other required technical data.Support internal tooling process.Ascertain all necessary work records are properly executed by the responsible technician.Ensures proper handling of all parts and preservation of all units or parts while in repair process or during process through the facility and after work is completed.Initiation of requisitions for stock and materials as required.Verifies that the technicians are properly trained to perform assigned tasks.Comply with repair station procedures (RSM /QCM) and company policies (SOP) when performing aircraft or component maintenance.Ensures that necessary tooling and equipment is made available to assigned technicians.Will be properly certificated in accordance with FAR Part 65.

Education

ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

High School/ GEDA&P and / or composite experience a plus

Experience

Generally at least 8 years of experience or greater in area of responsibility.Experience with regional aircraft; proficient in 2+ aircraft types; must be trained, proficient and show demonstrated skill with the aircraft that lead position is responsible for; has strong interpersonal skills; Been with EAMS for one year.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Assignments require Advanced Knowledge of all possible tasks and responsibilities within their Technical area as well as a strong understanding of External Regulations and Functional Work Standards that affect Technical Requirements and Outputs. Role takes leadership for applying new processes and skills to improve the Technician FunctionAbility to interpret and comprehend aircraft repair manuals, repair orders, and related blueprint drawings.Composite experience a plus.Ability to work different shifts and flexible hours if required.Be proficient in the usage of air powered hand tools and related equipment.

Working Conditions / Environment/ Special Requirements

Ability to work in a safe professional manner adhering to all regulatory requirements including, OSHA, EPA, State and Federal regulations.The Lead Aircraft Inspector will be properly certificated in accordance with either FAR 65 Subpart D or Subpart E.Ability to work flexible hours and different shifts if required.Employees will be subject to the random drug and alcohol testing under FAA regulations.Valid Drivers License.Must be able to work in hot/Cold – Indoor/Outdoor.Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs unassisted.Must be able to do work above head.Must be able to work at heights.Must be able to work in confined spaces.Must be able to climb.

GENERAL COMMITMENT FOR ALL EMPLOYEES

Commitment to company values and complies with department norms, policies, directives, and procedures. Incorporates Lean and P3E processes and concepts into daily activities. Strive for continuous improvement to processes and procedures. Honors and protects confidential and proprietary documents and information. Satisfies work schedule requirements. The job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of all activities, duties or responsibilities that are required by the employee. Performs other duties as assigned.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
